name: Asenapine

dosing.adult_acute: Sublingual: 5 mg BID; Transdermal patch: 3.8 mg/24h
dosing.notes: Sublingual ONLY - do NOT swallow; avoid eating/drinking 10 min after dose; transdermal patch alternative for adherence

canadian_clinical.titration_schedule: SL: Can increase to 10 mg BID after 1 week; Patch: Increase to 5.7 mg or 7.6 mg weekly
canadian_clinical.max_dose_practice: SL: 10 mg BID; Patch: 7.6 mg daily
canadian_clinical.inpatient_strategy: SL: Start 5-10 mg BID; ensure sublingual administration technique
canadian_clinical.outpatient_strategy: SL: 5 mg BID; increase to 10 mg BID if needed; Patch: Consider for adherence issues

warnings: Black box warning: Increased mortality in elderly with dementia-related psychosis
SUBLINGUAL ONLY - swallowing reduces bioavailability by 50%; no eating/drinking for 10 minutes after dose
Oral hypoesthesia (numbness) common with sublingual formulation
Weight gain and metabolic effects (moderate risk)
Sedation common - especially with initial dosing
Transdermal patch alternative for adherence (application site reactions possible)

cautions.hepatic: Contraindicated in severe hepatic impairment (Child-Pugh C)
